description:
Said Mohammed Aalghemni academic writer of a controversial Egypt holds a doctorate in the history of sociology of religion, was born in March 13, 1947 instrumental in the province of Beni Suef , most of his academic dealt with the thorny in the history of Islam. Some scholars considered in Islamic history from the viewpoint of Marxism and others consider the ideas were bold in addressing the ideology of the groups who believe in political Islam, while the same Mr. Aalghemni and on the tongue from the Al Jazeera television that he thought the outgoing man followed. Many described as an apostate, or trumpet horns of the United States for similar view with the U.S. Administration's view on the need to change the Islamic religious curriculum in Saudi Arabia in particular note that Aalghemni and his tongue had been advocating this change for decades prior to the call of modern America, which emerged after the events of September 11, 2001 was criticized by many to be based Recognizing the sources of Al-Azhar only tried in books such as the party Hashemi, who sold 40,000 copies even before the print and Muhammadiyah wars and a prophet to show the role of political factor in the decision-making religious Islamic history early in his book, while showing the Prophet Ibrahim secular analysis of the first two stories of the Prophets.
